title: TIAA-CREF Class W Mutual Funds With ER 0%
text:
T-C mutual funds have a 6th class.

All classes now: Advisor, Class W, Institutional, Premier, Retail, Retirement

Class W is basically the Institutional Class with the entire ER waived indefinitely. Access is very limited. Both active and passive funds are included.

These are so new that they don't yet appear in monthly TIAA IPS Reports that I watch.

I haven't seen any publicity on this. These are like Fido ZERO index funds [but those are available to retail].

Example, Active T-C G&I TGIWX https://www.tiaa.org/public/investment-performance/mutualfunds/profile?ticker=121095028

Website Data,

"GROSS / NET EXPENSE RATIO

A contractual arrangement is in place that limits certain fees and/or expenses. Had fees/expenses not been limited ("capped"), currently or in the past, returns would have been lower. This arrangement will remain in effect until terminated. Please see the prospectus for details.

0.40% / 0.00% "

From Prospectus,

" Class W shares are available for purchase directly from the Fund only by funds advised by Advisors [ Edit: Teachers Advisors ] or its affiliates or other clients or accounts of Advisors or its affiliates that are subject to a contractual fee for advisory, management or other similar or related services provided by Advisors or its affiliates. "

YBB
description: T-C mutual funds have a 6th class. All classes now: Advisor, Class W, Institutional, Premier, Retail, Retirement Class W is basically the Institutional - 20651
